column4: hey when I try sudo apt-get update I get this error: W: GPG error: http://ppa.launchpad.net maverick Release: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: KEY. After that I put this in the terminal: gpg --keyserver hkp://subkeys.pgp.net --recv-keys KEY. But than it says gpgkeys: key KEY not found on keyserver..
I know those can be fixed but most the time I ignore the key errors.  I don't think it breaks anything it's just a security risk.
I fixed two other errors like this, so I was wondering why this fix didn't work
maybe the server is down?  maybe it has a mirror site.
how do I check that?
its about the http://ppa.launchpad.net maverick Release
you can go to synaptic and setup>repositories>download from
oh then they give you instructions on the ppa site but I'm not sure those have mirrors.  you might just have to wait till the server start working again in a day or two.
I don't think the server is the problem, because I fixed two of those errors from the same ppa without problems, only for this one it doesnt find the gpgkey
will adding the ppa again maybe solve the problem?
did you fix those keys today?  time is an important factor.
about ten minutes ago
I'm not sure
that ppa stuf is in flux they guy that wrote may not even know how to setup keys.  it's done by people like you and me.
ppa is try at your own risk.
I now used this: gpg --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv KEY and now it imported a gpg key
thanks for your help :)
see just a server problem they don't always work
I will try another server when I get this problem again in the future
I don't think that's an option on ppa.  but maybe they do.
I think it was a problem with the authentication @ software sources
Launchpad VLC is now added
